00014 /**
00015  * The Push Notification Message.
00016  * 
00017  * The class represents a message to be delivered to an end user device.
00018  * Notification Service.
00019  * 
00020  * @ingroup ApnsPHP_Message
00021  * @see http://tinyurl.com/ApplePushNotificationPayload
00022  */ 
00023 class ApnsPHP_Message
00024 {
00025     protected $_aDeviceTokens = array(); /**< @type array Recipients device tokens. */
00026 
00027     protected $_sText; /**< @type string Alert message to display to the user. */
00028     protected $_nBadge; /**< @type integer Number to badge the application icon with. */
00029     protected $_sSound; /**< @type string Sound to play. */
00030     
00031     /**
00032      * Constructor.
00033      *
00034      * @param  $sDeviceToken @type string @optional Recipients device token.
00035      */
00036     public function __construct($sDeviceToken = null)
00037     {
00038         if (isset($sDeviceToken)) {
00039             $this->addRecipient($sDeviceToken);
00040         }
00041     }
00042     
00043     /**
00044      * Add a recipient device token.
00045      *
00046      * @param  $sDeviceToken @type string Recipients device token.
00047      * @throws ApnsPHP_Message_Exception if the device token
00048      *         is not well formed.
00049      */
00050     public function addRecipient($sDeviceToken)
00051     {
00052         if (!preg_match('~[a-f0-9]{64}~i', $sDeviceToken)) {
00053             throw new ApnsPHP_Message_Exception(
00054                 "Invalid device token '{$sDeviceToken}'"
00055             );
00056         }
00057         $this->_aDeviceTokens[] = $sDeviceToken;
00058     }
00059     
00060     /**
00061      * Get a recipient.
00062      *
00063      * @param  $nRecipient @type integer @optional Recipient number to return.
00064      * @throws ApnsPHP_Message_Exception if no recipient number
00065      *         exists.
00066      * @return @type string The recipient token at index $nRecipient.
00067      */
00068     public function getRecipient($nRecipient = 0)
00069     {
00070         if (!isset($this->_aDeviceTokens[$nRecipient])) {
00071             throw new ApnsPHP_Message_Exception(
00072                 "No recipient at index '{$nRecipient}'"
00073             );
00074         }
00075         return $this->_aDeviceTokens[$nRecipient];
00076     }
00077     
00078     /**
00079      * Get the number of recipients.
00080      *
00081      * @return @type integer Recipient's number.
00082      */
00083     public function getRecipientsNumber()
00084     {
00085         return count($this->_aDeviceTokens);
00086     }
00087     
00088     /**
00089      * Get all recipients.
00090      *
00091      * @return @type array Array of all recipients device token.
00092      */
00093     public function getRecipients()
00094     {
00095         return $this->_aDeviceTokens;
00096     }
00097     
00098     /**
00099      * Set the alert message to display to the user.
00100      *
00101      * @param  $sText @type string An alert message to display to the user.
00102      */
00103     public function setText($sText)
00104     {
00105         $this->_sText = $sText;
00106     }
00107 
00108     /**
00109      * Get the alert message to display to the user.
00110      *
00111      * @return @type string The alert message to display to the user.
00112      */
00113     public function getText()
00114     {
00115         return $this->_sText;
00116     }
00117 
00118     /**
00119      * Set the number to badge the application icon with.
00120      *
00121      * @param  $nBadge @type integer A number to badge the application icon with.
00122      * @throws ApnsPHP_Message_Exception if badge is not an
00123      *         integer.
00124      */
00125     public function setBadge($nBadge)
00126     {
00127         if (!is_int($nBadge)) {
00128             throw new ApnsPHP_Message_Exception(
00129                 "Invalid badge number '{$nBadge}'"
00130             );
00131         }
00132         $this->_nBadge = $nBadge;
00133     }
00134     
00135     /**
00136      * Get the number to badge the application icon with.
00137      *
00138      * @return @type integer The number to badge the application icon with.
00139      */
00140     public function getBadge()
00141     {
00142         return $this->_nBadge;
00143     }
00144 
00145     /**
00146      * Set the sound to play.
00147      *
00148      * @param  $sSound @type string A sound to play.
00149      */
00150     public function setSound($sSound)
00151     {
00152         $this->_sSound = $sSound;
00153     }
00154 
00155     /**
00156      * Get the sound to play.
00157      *
00158      * @return @type string The sound to play.
00159      */
00160     public function setSound($sSound)
00161     {
00162         $this->_sSound = $sSound;
00163     }
00164     
00165     /**
00166      * PHP Magic Method. When an object is "converted" to a string, JSON-encoded
00167      * payload is returned.
00168      *
00169      * @return @type string JSON-encoded payload.
00170      */
00171     public function __toString()
00172     {
00173         return $this->_getPayload();
00174     }
00175     
00176     /**
00177      * Convert the message in a JSON-encoded payload.
00178      *
00179      * @return @type string JSON-encoded payload.
00180      */
00181     protected function _getPayload()
00182     {
00183         $payload['aps'] = array();
00184         $p = &$payload['aps'];
00185         
00186         if (isset($this->_sText)) {
00187             $p['alert'] = (string)$this->_sText;
00188         }
00189         if (isset($this->_nBadge) && $this->_nBadge > 0) {
00190             $p['badge'] = (int)$this->_nBadge;
00191         }
00192         if (isset($this->_sSound)) {
00193             $p['sound'] = (string)$this->_sSound;
00194         }
00195         return json_encode($payload, JSON_FORCE_OBJECT);
00196     }
00197 }
